summary: This is a response from the FBI New York and the New York State Division of Criminal Justice Services to an inquiry, likely regarding a fingerprint search through the Interstate Identification Index (III). It indicates that records can be obtained via the NCIC transaction system.

persons.name: Michael C. Green
persons.role: Executive Deputy Commissioner of the NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services
persons.context: He is listed as the executive deputy commissioner of the NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services, which is the agency responding to the inquiry.

locations: Alfred E. Smith Building, 80 South Swan St., Albany, New York 12210
keyFacts: The document is a response to an inquiry for a search of the Interstate Identification Index (III) based on fingerprint classification.
It states that records can be obtained through the III by using the appropriate NCIC (National Crime Information Center) transaction.
The response is dated October 6, 2021, and comes from the FBI New York and the New York State Division of Criminal Justice Services.
